thread.title: Rain paves way to dust storm across UAE
thread.title_full: Rain paves way to dust storm across UAE | GulfNews.com

author: Gulf News Web Report
title: Rain paves way to dust storm across UAE
text:
Dubai: Intermittent rain paved way to dust storm across the UAE by midday on Friday. Dust enveloped most parts of the UAE, reducing visibility. pic.twitter.com/kJ3yh4o1dy — UAE WEATHER (@NCMS_media) February 17, 2017 
Forecasters predicted unstable weather on Friday and Saturday. #TrafficUpdate 
Motorists are urged to drive carefully due to decreased visibility caused by winds blowing dust. #DubaiPolice — Dubai Policeشرطة دبي (@DubaiPoliceHQ) February 17, 2017 
“The weather on Friday and Saturday will be generally the same, cloudy in general, with some light rain at short intervals for the whole day. South-easterly to north-easterly wind will affect the country but will be moderate to fresh, with average wind speed of around 30km/h to 40km/h in Dubai. For those who will be heading for outdoor activities such as walks, there’s nothing significant to worry about,” said a forecaster from the National Centre of Meteorology and Seismology. 
 
The country may also experience a drop in temperatures of about 5 degree Celsius beginning Saturday, bringing the average temperatures to 25C.
Another drop in temperatures is expected on Sunday although no rain is forecast. حالة الطقس و درجات الحرارة المتوقعة لثلاثة أيام على بعض مدن الدولة #ncms #الطقس #weatherforecast #uae #uaeweather pic.twitter.com/lIsqe9qe2p — UAE WEATHER (@NCMS_media) February 17, 2017
